Syntax Description Parameters - GapFillingContext3dimId For specifying the fill gaps 3D image processing context identifier - DepthMapImageBufId - IntensityMapImageBufId - ControlFlag Compilation information

subEntries.title: M3dimFilter
subEntries.text: M3dimFilter Synopsis Apply a smoothing filter to a point cloud. Syntax void M3dimFilter( MIL_ID FilterContext3dimId, //in MIL_ID SrcContainerBufId, //in MIL_ID DstContainerBufId, //in MIL_INT64 ControlFlag //in ) Description This function applies a smoothing filter to a point cloud. Filtering reduces noise by changing the positions of points, but does not eliminate them. If you want to invalidate outlier points, use M3dimOutliers(). You can choose the type of smoothing operation to perform, either bilateral or moving least squares (MLS). Use M3dimControl() with M_FILTER_MODE to set the mode. The MLS filter applies smoothing equally to surface and edge points. The bilateral filter, on the other hand, smooths points on faces, leaving edge points much less affected. The bilateral filter (M_SMOOTH_BILATERAL) uses the source point cloud's normal values. If a normals component does not already exist in the source point cloud, M3dimFilter() will calculate point normals and create a normals component, adding it to the destination container. In this case, use M3dimControl() with M_USE_SOURCE_NORMALS set to M_FALSE. Note that this is more efficient than separately calculating a normals component using M3dimNormals(). Nevertheless, the method used for computing normals could improve filter results. For more information, see the Smoothing a point cloud subsection of the Working with points in a point cloud section of Chapter 35: 3D image processing. Parameters Parameters FilterContext3dimId Specifies a filter 3D image processing context. For specifying the filter 3D image processing context identifier Value Description MIL filter 3D image processing context identifier Specifies the identifier of a filter 3D image processing context, previously allocated using M3dimAlloc() with M_FILTER_CONTEXT. The function applies the filter control settings specified using M3dimControl(). SrcContainerBufId Specifies the identifier of the 3D-processable point cloud container to use as the source. The container must be 3D-processable (that is, if you call MbufInquireContainer() with M_3D_PROCESSABLE, the function returns M_PROCESSABLE). The container must have been previously allocated using MbufAllocContainer() with M_PROC. DstContainerBufId Specifies the identifier of the destination container, previously allocated using MbufAllocContainer() with M_PROC. The destination container must not be a child container. ControlFlag Reserved for future expansion and must be set to M_DEFAULT. Compilation information Header Include mil.h. Library Use mil.lib; mil3dim.lib. DLL Requires mil.dll; mil3dim.dll. Syntax Description Parameters - FilterContext3dimId For specifying the filter 3D image processing context identifier - SrcContainerBufId - DstContainerBufId - ControlFlag Compilation information

subEntries.title: M3dimFindTransformation
subEntries.text: M3dimFindTransformation Synopsis Find the transformation between 2 sets of points. Syntax void M3dimFindTransformation( MIL_ID FindTransformationContext3dimId, //in MIL_ID SourceContainerOrArrayBufId, //in MIL_ID TargetContainerOrArrayBufId, //in MIL_ID Result3dimOrMatrix3dgeoId, //in MIL_INT64 ControlFlag //in ) Description This function finds the rigid or affine transformation between the source and target sets of points. MIL finds the transformation matrix A such that A * source (as per M3dimMatrixTransform()) best approximates the target. Specifically, the transformation minimizes the squared error between pairs of points. Source[x, y] is compared with Target[x, y]. Accordingly, this function works only when you know a specific pairing between the source and target points (for example, through feature extraction). For a function that finds an alignment but does not require an exact pairing, see M3dregCalculate(). Results are stored in the specified result buffer or transformation matrix object. To retrieve the matrix from a result buffer, use M3dimCopyResult() with M_TRANSFORMATION_MATRIX. The source and target can be both containers or both MIL array buffers (M_ARRAY), or any combination of the two. Note that only pairs with 2 valid points are considered. For a MIL array buffer, all points are valid; for a container, points are valid if their corresponding confidence score is non-zero. For this function to succeed, at least 3 non-collinear point pairs are required for a rigid transformation, and at least 4 non-coplanar point pairs are required for an affine transformation. If the operation fails, M3dimGetResult() with M_STATUS returns M_NOT_ENOUGH_POINT_PAIRS, M_ALL_POINTS_COPLANAR, or M_NOT_INITIALIZED, and the zero matrix is returned. Note that attempting to use the zero matrix in functions such as M3dimMatrixTransform() will cause an error. To verify that the matrix is a valid rigid or affine transformation and not the zero matrix, call M3dgeoInquire() with M_RIGID or M_AFFINE (respectively) and ensure that the function returns M_TRUE. Parameters Parameters FindTransformationContext3dimId Specifies the identifier of a find transformation 3D image processing context. For specifying the find transformation 3D image processing context identifier Value Description M_FIND_TRANSFORMATION_CONTEXT_AFFINE Specifies to find an affine transformation between the source and target sets of points. You should use this mode when one set of points (either source or target) originates from an uncalibrated source, which might contain a distortion such as a shear. Note that this mode requires at least 4 non-coplanar point pairs. M_FIND_TRANSFORMATION_CONTEXT_RIGID Specifies to find a rigid transformation between the source and target sets of points. You should use this mode when the two sets of points (source and target) differ by a physical displacement in three dimensions (for example, a rotation and/or translation). Note that this mode requires at least 3 non-collinear point pairs. SourceContainerOrArrayBufId Specifies the identifier of the source container containing a 3D-processable point cloud, or specifies the identifier of the source MIL array buffer. The container must have been previously allocated using MbufAllocContainer() with M_PROC, and must be 3D-processable (that is, if you call MbufInquireContainer() with M_3D_PROCESSABLE, the function returns M_PROCESSABLE). The source MIL array buffer must be a 3-band floating-point buffer, allocated using MbufAllocColor() with M_ARRAY, and must have the same size as the target. You can load values into the buffer using, for example, MbufPutColor(). TargetContainerOrArrayBufId Specifies the identifier of the target container containing a 3D-processable point cloud, or specifies the identifier of the target MIL array buffer. The container must have been previously allocated using MbufAllocContainer() with M_PROC, and must be 3D-processable (that is, if you call MbufInquireContainer() with M_3D_PROCESSABLE, the function returns M_PROCESSABLE). The target MIL array buffer must be a 3-band floating-point buffer, allocated using MbufAllocColor() with M_ARRAY, and must have the same size as the source. You can load values into the buffer using, for example, MbufPutColor(). Result3dimOrMatrix3dgeoId Specifies the identifier of the find transformation 3D image processing result buffer or transformation matrix object in which to store the calculated transformation matrix. The result buffer must have been allocated using M3dimAllocResult() with M_FIND_TRANSFORMATION_RESULT; the result buffer holds the transformation matrix and the status of the operation. The transformation matrix object must have been allocated using M3dgeoAlloc() with M_TRANSFORMATION_MATRIX. ControlFlag Reserved for future expansion and must be set to M_DEFAULT. Compilation information Header Include mil.h. Library Use mil.lib; mil3dim.lib. DLL Requires mil.dll; mil3dim.dll. Syntax Description Parameters - FindTransformationContext3dimId For specifying the find transformation 3D image processing context identifier - SourceContainerOrArrayBufId - TargetContainerOrArrayBufId - Result3dimOrMatrix3dgeoId - ControlFlag Compilation information

subEntries.title: M3dimFix
subEntries.text: M3dimFix Synopsis Determine if a container satisfies certain conditions and optionally fixes them if they are not met. Syntax void M3dimFix( MIL_ID SrcContainerBufId, //in MIL_ID DstContainerBufId, //in MIL_INT64 Conditions, //in MIL_INT64 ControlFlag, //in MIL_INT64 *ResultPtr //in ) Description This function allows you to validate whether a container meets a certain condition. You can use M3dimFix() to verify that a container is suitable for use with another 3D function. You can optionally specify a destination container to obtain a modified copy of the source container that fixes the specified conditions. Parameters Parameters SrcContainerBufId Specifies the identifier of the source point cloud container, previously allocated using MbufAllocContainer() with M_PROC. The container must be 3D processable (that is, if you call MbufInquireContainer() with M_3D_PROCESSABLE, the function returns M_PROCESSABLE). DstContainerBufId Specifies the identifier of the destination container in which to place the modified point cloud. The container must have been previously allocated using MbufAllocContainer() with M_PROC, and must not be a child container. If you do not want to retrieve a modified point cloud that satisfies the given conditions, you must set this parameter to M_NULL. Conditions Specifies which conditions you would like to be validated and optionally fixed. The values in the tables below can be added together to specify multiple conditions. For example, to verify that a mesh contains only valid points and that there are no degenerate triangles, specify M_MESH_VALID_POINTS + M_MESH_VALID_NEIGHBORS. For specifying the conditions to validate Value Description M_ALL Specifies to verify that all the conditions listed in this table are met. Conditions are only validated if the specified source point cloud container has the component required to validate the condition. If you specify a DstContainerBufId, you will retrieve a modified version of the source point cloud container that satisfies all the valid conditions for it. M_MESH_VALID_NEIGHBORS Specifies to check each edge in the mesh to verify that the edge appears in at most two triangular faces. Triangular faces are also verified to ensure that they are constructed from three different vertices to ensure that there are no degenerate triangular faces in the mesh. This option is available when the source container has an M_COMPONENT_MESH_MIL component. M_MESH_VALID_NEIGHBORS must be satisfied for some functions which use a mesh component, such as M3dmetVolume(). If you specify a destination container and more than two triangular faces are found sharing a common edge, the first two faces are kept, while the subsequent triangles are removed. M_MESH_VALID_POINTS Specifies to check that each point in the mesh is valid; a valid point has a non-zero confidence score. This option is available when the source container has an M_COMPONENT_MESH_MIL component. M_MESH_VALID_POINTS must be satisfied for all functions that use a mesh component. If you specify a destination container, any invalid point in the mesh that corresponds to the vertex of a triangular face results in that face's removal. M_NORMALS_FINITE Specifies to check that each point in the range component has a finite normal vector. This option is available when the source container has an M_COMPONENT_NORMALS_MIL component. M_NORMALS_FINITE must be satisfied for all functions that use a normals component. If you specify a DstContainerBufId and points with infinite normal vectors are found, the point's confidence is set to 0 and the normals length is set to the range's invalid value. You can set this value using M_3D_INVALID_DATA_VALUE with MbufControl(). M_NORMALS_NORMALIZED Specifies to check that each point with a non-zero confidence has a normal with a norm of exactly one or zero. This option is available when the source container has an M_COMPONENT_NORMALS_MIL component. M_NORMALS_NORMALIZED must be satisfied for all functions that use a normals component. If you specify a DstContainerBufId and normals are found without a norm of one or zero, they will be normalized to have a norm of one. M_RANGE_FINITE Specifies to check that each point in the range component is finite. M_RANGE_FINITE is required for all 3D functions. If you specify a DstContainerBufId and invalid points are found, the point's confidence is set to 0 and the point is set to the range's invalid value. You can set this value using M_3D_INVALID_DATA_VALUE with MbufControl(). M_UNREPLICATED_POINTS Specifies to check that each point in the range component with a non-zero confidence is unreplicated. If you specify a DstContainerBufId and replicated points are found, the point's confidence is set to 0. Note that when two points are replicates, either of the points could be removed. ControlFlag Reserved for future expansion. This parameter must be set to M_DEFAULT. ResultPtr Specifies the address of the variable in which to write the conditions that were detected. Alternatively, if you do not want to return the conditions, you can set this parameter to M_NULL. Compilation information Header Include mil.h. Library Use mil.lib; mil3dim.lib. DLL Requires mil.dll; mil3dim.dll. Syntax Description Parameters - SrcContainerBufId - DstContainerBufId - Conditions For specifying the conditions to validate - ControlFlag - ResultPtr Compilation information

subEntries.title: M3dimFree
subEntries.text: M3dimFree Synopsis Free a 3D image processing context or result buffer. Syntax void M3dimFree( MIL_ID ContextOrResult3dimId //in ) Description This function deletes the specified 3D image processing context or result buffer identifier, and releases any memory associated with it. All 3D image processing contexts or result buffers allocated on a particular system must be freed before the system can be freed, unless M_UNIQUE_ID was specified during allocation. Parameters Parameter ContextOrResult3dimId Specifies the identifier of the 3D image processing context or result buffer to free. These must have been successfully allocated (using M3dimAlloc() or M3dimAllocResult()) prior to calling this function. Compilation information Header Include mil.h. Library Use mil.lib; mil3dim.lib. DLL Requires mil.dll; mil3dim.dll. Syntax Description Parameters - ContextOrResult3dimId Compilation information

subEntries.title: M3dimGet
subEntries.text: M3dimGet Synopsis Get valid points or other component values from a container's point cloud or depth map, or get values from a depth map image. Syntax MIL_INT M3dimGet( MIL_ID ContainerOrImageBufId, //in MIL_INT64 Component, //in MIL_INT ArraySize, //in MIL_INT64 Options, //in MIL_DOUBLE *DstCoord1OrPackedArrayPtr, //out MIL_DOUBLE *DstCoord2ArrayPtr, //out MIL_DOUBLE *DstCoord3ArrayPtr //out ) Description This function returns a component's values that correspond to valid points in the source point cloud or depth map container, or it returns valid values in a depth map image, excluding invalid points and points outside a region of interest (if the depth map image buffer is associated with an ROI). When copying from a floating-point buffer to an integer array, the values are truncated. If the source buffer depth is greater than that of the destination array, the most significant bits are truncated when the data is copied into the destination. For a depth map image, you can limit this function's results to a region of the depth map image buffer using a region of interest (ROI) set using MbufSetRegion(). The ROI must be defined in raster format (M_RASTER or M_VECTOR_AND_RASTER). An error is generated if the ROI is only in vector format (M_VECTOR). To get all the coordinates stored in a component, regardless of the corresponding confidence score, use MbufGet(). Note that presented above is an example prototype of this function. You can call M3dimGet() with the same prototype as any of the type-specific functions below, without using the function's type-specific name; that is, use M3dimGet() and not, for example, M3dimGetFloat(). MIL automatically casts the data into the appropriate type. This is true except when using a C compiler. When using a C compiler, you must always call this function with its type-specific name (you cannot use the standard name of this function). Parameters Parameters ContainerOrImageBufId Specifies the identifier of the source point cloud container, depth map container, or depth map image buffer. The point cloud or depth map container must have been previously allocated using MbufAllocContainer() with M_PROC. The point cloud container must be 3D-processable (that is, if you call MbufInquireContainer() with M_3D_PROCESSABLE, the function returns M_PROCESSABLE). The depth map container must store data in a 3D-processable depth map format (that is, if you call MbufInquireContainer() with M_3D_PROCESSABLE_DEPTH_MAP, the function returns M_TRUE). The image buffer must be an 8-bit, 16-bit, or 32-bit unsigned buffer, and must contain a fully corrected depth map (that is, if you call McalInquire() with M_DEPTH_MAP, the function returns M_TRUE). If you specify an image buffer that has an ROI associated with it, the ROI must be in raster format; otherwise, you will get an error. Component Specifies the component from which to get values. The specified component must be of the same size as that of M_COMPONENT_RANGE, and must be an 8-bit, 16-bit or 32-bit image buffer. If the required component is not the same size, use MbufGet() instead. When ContainerOrImageBufId is a depth map image buffer, you must set Component to M_DEFAULT. Use the following settings to specify a component using its identifier or index. An error is generated if there is no component in the container matching the specified identifier or index. For specifying a component by its identifier or index Value Description M_COMPONENT_BY_ID( MIL_INT ID ) Specifies the component, in the container, that has the specified buffer identifier. Parameters ID Specifies the MIL identifier of the component. M_COMPONENT_BY_INDEX( MIL_INT ComponentIndex ) Specifies the component, in the container, at the specified index. Parameters ComponentIndex Specifies the index of the component. Use the following settings to specify a component by its component type, which identifies what kind of information the component stores. For specifying a component by its component type Value Description M_COMPONENT_CONFIDENCE Specifies that the component stores confidence information for the M_COMPONENT_RANGE component of the container. Coordinates associated with the confidence value 0 are considered invalid data and will not be used by 3D image processing functions. M_COMPONENT_COORDINATE_MAP_A_MIL Specifies that the component stores the A coordinate map provided by the camera. When using MbufConvert3d() with a projective map, this component can be used instead of the column index of each corresponding pixel and will result in a better representation of the camera's lens model when generating X-coordinates. A coordinate map component is associated with a range component in the same container when there is only one range component and only one type of each coordinate map component in that container. Note that this component is only available if it is provided by the camera. For more information refer to your cameras manual. M_COMPONENT_COORDINATE_MAP_B_MIL Specifies that the component stores the B coordinate map provided by the camera. When using MbufConvert3d() with a projective map, this component can be used instead of the row index of each corresponding pixel and will result in a better representation of the camera's lens model when generating Y-coordinates. A coordinate map component is associated with a range component in the same container when there is only one range component and only one type of each coordinate map component in that container. Note that this component is only available if it is provided by the camera. For more information refer to your cameras manual. M_COMPONENT_CUSTOM + n Specifies that the component has a custom component type, identified by n, where n can be a value between 0 and 254. You can use custom component types to identify components which store information that does not fit one of the standard component types. In addition, some cameras transmit components with custom component types. Refer to your camera manual to determine what type of information is stored in transmitted components. M_COMPONENT_DISPARITY Specifies that the component stores a disparity map. Each pixel of a disparity map indicates the apparent distance (typically measured in pixel units) between where an object appears in the left and right images captured by a stereoscopic camera. M_COMPONENT_INFRARED Specifies that the component stores an intensity image of infrared light. M_COMPONENT_INTENSITY Specifies that the component stores an intensity image of visible light. M_COMPONENT_METADATA Specifies that the component stores metadata information. Metadata components are used by MIL internally. Typically, you should ignore metadata components in your application. M_COMPONENT_MULTISPECTRAL Specifies that the component stores an intensity image where each band represents the intensity of a specific wavelength of light. Unlike an intensity component, a multispectral component might include information about non-visible light. M_COMPONENT_NORMALS_MIL Specifies that the component stores normals information for each point in the M_COMPONENT_RANGE component of the container. M_COMPONENT_RANGE Specifies that the component stores 3D position information. This is a 3-band buffer that stores coordinates of 3D points. M_COMPONENT_REFLECTANCE Specifies that the component stores a reflectance map. Each pixel of a reflectance map indicates how much of the light hitting an object at that location is reflected back. Typically, this is an intensity image of the light spectrum used by a 3D sensor to detect 3D distance/position information. Typically, if the map was generated by a laser profiler, each row indicates the detected intensity of the laser for a single scan. M_COMPONENT_SCATTER Specifies that the component stores a scatter map. Each pixel of a scatter map indicates how much of the light hitting an object at that location is detected scattering beneath the object's surface. M_COMPONENT_ULTRAVIOLET Specifies that the component stores an intensity image of ultraviolet light. M_COMPONENT_UNDEFINED Specifies that the component stores information of an unknown type. ArraySize Specifies the maximum number of elements that the arrays can hold. If the specified ArraySize is larger than the number of points written, the rest of the array is left unchanged; if ArraySize is less than the number of points available, the points are written up to the specified ArraySize. When determining the required size of the arrays for subsequent calls to M3dimGet(), set this parameter to M_NULL. When using a standard vector (std::vector) overload function in C++, you can pass M_DEFAULT to this parameter and MIL will automatically determine the size based on the number of items in the vector passed to the DstCoord1OrPackedArrayPtr, DstCoord2ArrayPtr, or DstCoord3ArrayPtr parameter. Options Specifies additional options. For specifying the storage format Value Description M_DEFAULT Same as M_PLANAR. M_PACKED Specifies to store the component data in a packed format. M_PLANAR Specifies to store the component data in a planar format. DstCoord1OrPackedArrayPtr Accepts the address of one of the following: array of type MIL_DOUBLE [optionally, in C++: a reference to a std::vector<MIL_DOUBLE> ] (and a maximum array rank for C# of 1) Required array size:(ArraySize) array of type MIL_FLOAT [optionally, in C++: a reference to a std::vector<MIL_FLOAT> ] (and a maximum array rank for C# of 1) Required array size:(ArraySize) array of type MIL_INT16 [optionally, in C++: a reference to a std::vector<MIL_INT16> ] (and a maximum array rank for C# of 1) Required array size:(ArraySize) array of type MIL_INT32 [optionally, in C++: a reference to a std::vector<MIL_INT32> ] (and a maximum array rank for C# of 1) Required array size:(ArraySize) array of type MIL_INT8 [optionally, in C++: a reference to a std::vector<MIL_INT8> ] (and a maximum array rank for C# of 1) Required array size:(ArraySize) array of type MIL_UINT16 [optionally, in C++: a reference to a std::vector<MIL_UINT16> ] (and a maximum array rank for C# of 1) Required array size:(ArraySize) array of type MIL_UINT32 [optionally, in C++: a reference to a std::vector<MIL_UINT32> ] (and a maximum array rank for C# of 1) Required array size:(ArraySize) array of type MIL_UINT8 [optionally, in C++: a reference to a std::vector<MIL_UINT8> ] (and a maximum array rank for C# of 1) Required array size:(ArraySize) Specifies the address of the user array in which to store the retrieved data. This array can hold the values of the specified point cloud or depth map's component, or a packed array of all the data. For instance, a depth map's 3 bands of coordinate data, if packed, is stored in the array in an interleaved manner (for example, XYZ XYZ XYZ...). When determining the required size of this array for subsequent calls to M3dimGet(), set this parameter to M_NULL. DstCoord2ArrayPtr Accepts the address of one of the following: array of type MIL_DOUBLE [optionally, in C++: a reference to a std::vector<MIL_DOUBLE> ] (and a maximum array rank for C# of 1) Required array size:(ArraySize) array of type MIL_FLOAT [optionally, in C++: a reference to a std::vector<MIL_FLOAT> ] (and a maximum array rank for C# of 1) Required array size:(ArraySize) array of type MIL_INT16 [optionally, in C++: a reference to a std::vector<MIL_INT16> ] (and a maximum array rank for C# of 1) Required array size:(ArraySize) array of type MIL_INT32 [optionally, in C++: a reference to a std::vector<MIL_INT32> ] (and a maximum array rank for C# of 1) Required array size:(ArraySize) array of type MIL_INT8 [optionally, in C++: a reference to a std::vector<MIL_INT8> ] (and a maximum array rank for C# of 1) Required array size:(ArraySize) array of type MIL_UINT16 [optionally, in C++: a reference to a std::vector<MIL_UINT16> ] (and a maximum array rank for C# of 1) Required array size:(ArraySize) array of type MIL_UINT32 [optionally, in C++: a reference to a std::vector<MIL_UINT32> ] (and a maximum array rank for C# of 1) Required array size:(ArraySize) array of type MIL_UINT8 [optionally, in C++: a reference to a std::vector<MIL_UINT8> ] (and a maximum array rank for C# of 1) Required array size:(ArraySize) Specifies the address of the user array in which to store the retrieved data. If the component is 3-band and Options is set to M_PLANAR, the pointer passed to DstCoord2ArrayPtr must be valid. If the component is 1-band or Options is set to M_PACKED, set DstCoord2ArrayPtr to M_NULL. When determining the required size of this array for subsequent calls to M3dimGet(), set this parameter to M_NULL. DstCoord3ArrayPtr Accepts the address of one of the following: array of type MIL_DOUBLE [optionally, in C++: a reference to a std::vector<MIL_DOUBLE> ] (and a maximum array rank for C# of 1) Required array size:(ArraySize) array of type MIL_FLOAT [optionally, in C++: a reference to a std::vector<MIL_FLOAT> ] (and a maximum array rank for C# of 1) Required array size:(ArraySize) array of type MIL_INT16 [optionally, in C++: a reference to a std::vector<MIL_INT16> ] (and a maximum array rank for C# of 1) Required array size:(ArraySize) array of type MIL_INT32 [optionally, in C++: a reference to a std::vector<MIL_INT32> ] (and a maximum array rank for C# of 1) Required array size:(ArraySize) array of type MIL_INT8 [optionally, in C++: a reference to a std::vector<MIL_INT8> ] (and a maximum array rank for C# of 1) Required array size:(ArraySize) array of type MIL_UINT16 [optionally, in C++: a reference to a std::vector<MIL_UINT16> ] (and a maximum array rank for C# of 1) Required array size:(ArraySize) array of type MIL_UINT32 [optionally, in C++: a reference to a std::vector<MIL_UINT32> ] (and a maximum array rank for C# of 1) Required array size:(ArraySize) array of type MIL_UINT8 [optionally, in C++: a reference to a std::vector<MIL_UINT8> ] (and a maximum array rank for C# of 1) Required array size:(ArraySize) Specifies the address of the user array in which to store the retrieved data. If the component is 3-band and Options is set to M_PLANAR, the pointer passed to DstCoord3ArrayPtr must be valid. If the component is 1-band or Options is set to M_PACKED, set DstCoord3ArrayPtr to M_NULL. When determining the required size of this array for subsequent calls to M3dimGet(), set this parameter to M_NULL. Return value The returned value is the number of entries written into the array(s). If DstCoord1OrPackedArrayPtr, DstCoord2ArrayPtr and DstCoord3ArrayPtr are set to M_NULL, M3dimGet() returns the required size of the array(s) for subsequent calls to the function. Type-specific versions of the function when using a C compiler MIL_INT M3dimGetDouble (MIL_ID ContainerOrImageBufId, MIL_INT64 Component, MIL_INT ArraySize, MIL_INT64 Options, MIL_DOUBLE *DstCoord1OrPackedArrayPtr, MIL_DOUBLE *DstCoord2ArrayPtr, MIL_DOUBLE *DstCoord3ArrayPtr) Details Parameters ContainerOrImageBufId See ContainerOrImageBufId of the main function for a description. Component See Component of the main function for a description. ArraySize See ArraySize of the main function for a description. Options See Options of the main function for a description. DstCoord1OrPackedArrayPtr See DstCoord1OrPackedArrayPtr of the main function for a description. DstCoord2ArrayPtr See DstCoord2ArrayPtr of the main function for a description. DstCoord3ArrayPtr See DstCoord3ArrayPtr of the main function for a description. MIL_INT M3dimGetFloat (MIL_ID ContainerOrImageBufId, MIL_INT64 Component, MIL_INT ArraySize, MIL_INT64 Options, MIL_FLOAT *DstCoord1OrPackedArrayPtr, MIL_FLOAT *DstCoord2ArrayPtr, MIL_FLOAT *DstCoord3ArrayPtr) Details Parameters ContainerOrImageBufId See ContainerOrImageBufId of the main function for a description. Component See Component of the main function for a description. ArraySize See ArraySize of the main function for a description. Options See Options of the main function for a description. DstCoord1OrPackedArrayPtr See DstCoord1OrPackedArrayPtr of the main function for a description. DstCoord2ArrayPtr See DstCoord2ArrayPtr of the main function for a description. subEntries.title: M3dimGetList
subEntries.text: M3dimGetList Synopsis Read the values in a source container or depth map image, at the specified positions, and place the values in the specified destination arrays. Syntax MIL_INT M3dimGetList( MIL_ID ContainerOrImageBufId, //in MIL_INT64 Component, //in MIL_INT SrcArraySize, //in const MIL_DOUBLE *SrcPixelXArrayPtr, //in const MIL_DOUBLE *SrcPixelYArrayPtr, //in MIL_INT64 Options, //in MIL_DOUBLE *DstCoord1OrPackedArrayPtr, //out MIL_DOUBLE *DstCoord2ArrayPtr, //out MIL_DOUBLE *DstCoord3ArrayPtr, //out MIL_INT32 *IndexArrayPtr //out ) Description This function reads the values in a source container or depth map image buffer, at the specified positions, and places the values in the specified destination arrays. If the source is a container, you must specify from which component to copy the data. Each X/Y pair listed in the source arrays specifies the position of a point in its container's 2D grid organization (or pixel location in a depth map). Unlike MbufGetList(), this function has options for casting, storing the data in packed or planar format, and handling invalid points. It also returns the number of points written to the arrays. Note that the source array(s) can specify positions with subpixel precision. In this case, the source buffer is typically an organized point cloud. To establish values for the destination array(s), you can specify to interpolate between neighboring values that surround each subpixel position in the container's specified component. To determine the size of the arrays required to store the requested values, call this function and set DstCoord1OrPackedArrayPtr, DstCoord2ArrayPtr and DstCoord3ArrayPtr to M_NULL. The function will return the required array size(s). Note that presented above is an example prototype of this function. You can call M3dimGetList() with the same prototype as any of the type-specific functions below, without using the function's type-specific name; that is, use M3dimGetList() and not, for example, M3dimGetListDoubleInt16(). MIL automatically casts the data into the appropriate type. This is true except when using a C compiler. When using a C compiler, you must always call this function with its type-specific name (you cannot use the standard name of this function). Parameters Parameters ContainerOrImageBufId Specifies the identifier of the source point cloud container, depth map container, or depth map image buffer. The point cloud or depth map container must have been previously allocated using MbufAllocContainer() with M_PROC. The point cloud container must be 3D-processable (that is, if you call MbufInquireContainer() with M_3D_PROCESSABLE, the function returns M_PROCESSABLE). The depth map container must store data in a 3D-processable depth map format (that is, if you call MbufInquireContainer() with M_3D_PROCESSABLE_DEPTH_MAP, the function returns M_TRUE). The image buffer must be an 8-bit, 16-bit, or 32-bit unsigned buffer, and must contain a fully corrected depth map (that is, if you call McalInquire() with M_DEPTH_MAP, the function returns M_TRUE). If you specify an image buffer that has an ROI associated with it, the ROI must be in raster format; otherwise, you will get an error. Component Specifies the component from which to get point information. The specified component must be the same size as that of M_COMPONENT_RANGE, and must be an 8-bit, 16-bit or 32-bit image buffer. If the required component is not the same size, use MbufGetList() instead. When ContainerOrImageBufId is a depth map image buffer, you must set Component to M_DEFAULT. Use the following settings to specify a component using its identifier or index. An error is generated if there is no component in the container matching the specified identifier or index. For specifying a component by its identifier or index Value Description M_COMPONENT_BY_ID( MIL_INT ID ) Specifies the component, in the container, that has the specified buffer identifier. Parameters ID Specifies the MIL identifier of the component. M_COMPONENT_BY_INDEX( MIL_INT ComponentIndex ) Specifies the component, in the container, at the specified index. Parameters ComponentIndex Specifies the index of the component. Use the following settings to specify a component by its component type, which identifies what kind of information the component stores. For specifying a component by its component type Value Description M_COMPONENT_CONFIDENCE Specifies that the component stores confidence information for the M_COMPONENT_RANGE component of the container. Coordinates associated with the confidence value 0 are considered invalid data and will not be used by 3D image processing functions. M_COMPONENT_COORDINATE_MAP_A_MIL Specifies that the component stores the A coordinate map provided by the camera. When using MbufConvert3d() with a projective map, this component can be used instead of the column index of each corresponding pixel and will result in a better representation of the camera's lens model when generating X-coordinates. A coordinate map component is associated with a range component in the same container when there is only one range component and only one type of each coordinate map component in that container. Note that this component is only available if it is provided by the camera. For more information refer to your cameras manual. M_COMPONENT_COORDINATE_MAP_B_MIL Specifies that the component stores the B coordinate map provided by the camera. When using MbufConvert3d() with a projective map, this component can be used instead of the row index of each corresponding pixel and will result in a better representation of the camera's lens model when generating Y-coordinates. A coordinate map component is associated with a range component in the same container when there is only one range component and only one type of each coordinate map component in that container. Note that this component is only available if it is provided by the camera. For more information refer to your cameras manual. M_COMPONENT_CUSTOM + n Specifies that the component has a custom component type, identified by n, where n can be a value between 0 and 254. You can use custom component types to identify components which store information that does not fit one of the standard component types. In addition, some cameras transmit components with custom component types. Refer to your camera manual to determine what type of information is stored in transmitted components. M_COMPONENT_DISPARITY Specifies that the component stores a disparity map. Each pixel of a disparity map indicates the apparent distance (typically measured in pixel units) between where an object appears in the left and right images captured by a stereoscopic camera. M_COMPONENT_INFRARED Specifies that the component stores an intensity image of infrared light. M_COMPONENT_INTENSITY Specifies that the component stores an intensity image of visible light. M_COMPONENT_METADATA Specifies that the component stores metadata information. Metadata components are used by MIL internally. Typically, you should ignore metadata components in your application. M_COMPONENT_MULTISPECTRAL Specifies that the component stores an intensity image where each band represents the intensity of a specific wavelength of light. Unlike an intensity component, a multispectral component might include information about non-visible light. M_COMPONENT_NORMALS_MIL Specifies that the component stores normals information for each point in the M_COMPONENT_RANGE component of the container. M_COMPONENT_RANGE Specifies that the component stores 3D distance/position information. This is a 3-band buffer that stores coordinates of 3D points. M_COMPONENT_REFLECTANCE Specifies that the component stores a reflectance map. Each pixel of a reflectance map indicates how much of the light hitting an object at that location is reflected back. Typically, this is an intensity image of the light spectrum used by a 3D sensor to detect 3D distance/position information. Typically, if the map was generated by a laser profiler, each row indicates the detected intensity of the laser for a single scan. M_COMPONENT_SCATTER Specifies that the component stores a scatter map. Each pixel of a scatter map indicates how much of the light hitting an object at that location is detected scattering beneath the object's surface. M_COMPONENT_ULTRAVIOLET Specifies that the component stores an intensity image of ultraviolet light. M_COMPONENT_UNDEFINED Specifies that the component stores information of an unknown type. SrcArraySize Specifies the number of values in the source array(s). When using a standard vector (std::vector) overload function in C++, you can pass M_DEFAULT to this parameter and MIL will automatically determine the size based on the number of items in the vector passed to the SrcPixelXArrayPtr or SrcPixelYArrayPtr parameter. SrcPixelXArrayPtr Accepts the address of one of the following: array of type MIL_DOUBLE [optionally, in C++: a reference to a constant std::vector<MIL_DOUBLE> ] (and a maximum array rank for C# of 1) Required array size:(SrcArraySize) array of type MIL_FLOAT [optionally, in C++: a reference to a std::vector<MIL_FLOAT> ] (and a maximum array rank for C# of 1) Required array size:Call M3dimGetList() with DstCoord1OrPackedArrayPtr set to M_NULL, DstCoord2ArrayPtr set to M_NULL, DstCoord3ArrayPtr set to M_NULL, and IndexArrayPtr set to M_NULL. The array size is stored in the return value of the function. array of type MIL_INT16 [optionally, in C++: a reference to a std::vector<MIL_INT16> ] (and a maximum array rank for C# of 1) Required array size:Call M3dimGetList() with DstCoord1OrPackedArrayPtr set to M_NULL, DstCoord2ArrayPtr set to M_NULL, DstCoord3ArrayPtr set to M_NULL, and IndexArrayPtr set to M_NULL. The array size is stored in the return value of the function. array of type MIL_INT32 [optionally, in C++: a reference to a constant std::vector<MIL_INT32> ] (and a maximum array rank for C# of 1) Required array size:(SrcArraySize) array of type MIL_INT8 [optionally, in C++: a reference to a std::vector<MIL_INT8> ] (and a maximum array rank for C# of 1) Required array size:Call M3dimGetList() with DstCoord1OrPackedArrayPtr set to M_NULL, DstCoord2ArrayPtr set to M_NULL, DstCoord3ArrayPtr set to M_NULL, and IndexArrayPtr set to M_NULL. The array size is stored in the return value of the function. array of type MIL_UINT16 [optionally, in C++: a reference to a std::vector<MIL_UINT16> ] (and a maximum array rank for C# of 1) Required array size:Call M3dimGetList() with DstCoord1OrPackedArrayPtr set to M_NULL, DstCoord2ArrayPtr set to M_NULL, DstCoord3ArrayPtr set to M_NULL, and IndexArrayPtr set to M_NULL. The array size is stored in the return value of the function. array of type MIL_UINT32 [optionally, in C++: a reference to a std::vector<MIL_UINT32> ] (and a maximum array rank for C# of 1) Required array size:Call M3dimGetList() with DstCoord1OrPackedArrayPtr set to M_NULL, DstCoord2ArrayPtr set to M_NULL, DstCoord3ArrayPtr set to M_NULL, and IndexArrayPtr set to M_NULL. The array size is stored in the return value of the function. array of type MIL_UINT8 [optionally, in C++: a reference to a std::vector<MIL_UINT8> ] (and a maximum array rank for C# of 1) Required array size:Call M3dimGetList() with DstCoord1OrPackedArrayPtr set to M_NULL, DstCoord2ArrayPtr set to M_NULL, DstCoord3ArrayPtr set to M_NULL, and IndexArrayPtr set to M_NULL. The array size is stored in the return value of the function. Specifies the address of an array containing the X-positions of values to get. Each position is that of a point in its container's 2D grid organization (or pixel location in a depth map). Positions can be specified with subpixel precision. SrcPixelYArrayPtr Accepts the address of one of the following: array of type MIL_DOUBLE [optionally, in C++: a reference to a constant std::vector<MIL_DOUBLE> ] (and a maximum array rank for C# of 1) Required array size:(SrcArraySize) array of type MIL_FLOAT [optionally, in C++: a reference to a std::vector<MIL_FLOAT> ] (and a maximum array rank for C# of 1) Required array size:Call M3dimGetList() with DstCoord1OrPackedArrayPtr set to M_NULL, DstCoord2ArrayPtr set to M_NULL, DstCoord3ArrayPtr set to M_NULL, and IndexArrayPtr set to M_NULL. The array size is stored in the return value of the function. array of type MIL_INT16 [optionally, in C++: a reference to a std::vector<MIL_INT16> ] (and a maximum array rank for C# of 1) Required array size:Call M3dimGetList() with DstCoord1OrPackedArrayPtr set to M_NULL, DstCoord2ArrayPtr set to M_NULL, DstCoord3ArrayPtr set to M_NULL, and IndexArrayPtr set to M_NULL. The array size is stored in the return value of the function. array of type MIL_INT32 [optionally, in C++: a reference to a constant std::vector<MIL_INT32> ] (and a maximum array rank for C# of 1) Required array size:(SrcArraySize) array of type MIL_INT8 [optionally, in C++: a reference to a std::vector<MIL_INT8> ] (and a maximum array rank for C# of 1) Required array size:Call M3dimGetList() with DstCoord1OrPackedArrayPtr set to M_NULL, DstCoord2ArrayPtr set to M_NULL, DstCoord3ArrayPtr set to M_NULL, and IndexArrayPtr set to M_NULL. The array size is stored in the return value of the function. array of type MIL_UINT16 [optionally, in C++: a reference to a std::vector<MIL_UINT16> ] (and a maximum array rank for C# of 1) Required array size:Call M3dimGetList() with DstCoord1OrPackedArrayPtr set to M_NULL, DstCoord2ArrayPtr set to M_NULL, DstCoord3ArrayPtr set to M_NULL, and IndexArrayPtr set to M_NULL. The array size is stored in the return value of the function. array of type MIL_UINT32 [optionally, in C++: a reference to a std::vector<MIL_UINT32> ] (and a maximum array rank for C# of 1) Required array size:Call M3dimGetList() with DstCoord1OrPackedArrayPtr set to M_NULL, DstCoord2ArrayPtr set to M_NULL, DstCoord3ArrayPtr set to M_NULL, and IndexArrayPtr set to M_NULL. The array size is stored in the return value of the function. array of type MIL_UINT8 [optionally, in C++: a reference to a std::vector<MIL_UINT8> ] (and a maximum array rank for C# of 1) Required array size:Call M3dimGetList() with DstCoord1OrPackedArrayPtr set to M_NULL, DstCoord2ArrayPtr set to M_NULL, DstCoord3ArrayPtr set to M_NULL, and IndexArrayPtr set to M_NULL. The array size is stored in the return value of the function. Specifies the address of an array containing the Y-positions of values to get. Each position is that of a point in its container's 2D grid organization (or pixel location in a depth map). Positions can be specified with subpixel precision. If the source container is unorganized, you can set this parameter to M_NULL. Options Specifies additional options. Note that you can combine settings (for example, M_PACKED + M_BILINEAR + M_INCLUDE_INVALID_POINTS). Any option not specified uses the default value. For instance, setting this parameter to M_PACKED also sets M_NEAREST_NEIGHBOR and M_SKIP_INVALID_POINTS, even though M_PACKED is the only explicitly-set value. For specifying default options Value Description M_DEFAULT Same as M_PLANAR + M_NEAREST_NEIGHBOR + M_SKIP_INVALID_POINTS. Combination values that can be used alone or as combination values for any of the possible values of the Options parameter. You can use one of the following values on its own, or add it to the above-mentioned value, to specify the storage format in the destination array(s). For specifying the storage format Value Description M_PACKED Specifies to store the data in a packed format. M_PLANAR Specifies to store the data in a planar format. This is the default value. Combination values that can be used alone or as combination values for any of the possible values of the Options parameter. You can use one of the following values on its own, or add it to the above-mentioned value, to specify how to interpret subpixel positions in the source array(s). For specifying how to interpret subpixel positions in the source array(s) Value Description M_BILINEAR Specifies bilinear interpolation. The value placed in the user-defined array is determined by taking a weighted average of the 4 values (2x2) that surround the subpixel position. If any of the 4 surrounding values is invalid, M_NEAREST_NEIGHBOR is used instead. M_NEAREST_NEIGHBOR Specifies nearest neighbor interpolation. The value placed in the user-defined array is that of the value of the pixel closest to the subpixel position. This is the default value. Combination values that can be used alone or as combination values for any of the possible values of the Options parameter. You can use one of the following values on its own, or add it to the above-mentioned value, to specify how to deal with invalid points. For specifying how to deal with invalid points Value Description M_INCLUDE_INVALID_POINTS Specifies to include invalid points. If a point is invalid, the function writes an unspecified value in the data output array(s) and -1 in the source-index array (IndexArrayPtr). For example, if the input confidence = [1, 0, 1, 0, 1], and the input component = [3, 1, 4, 1, 5], then the data output array = [3, ?, 4, ?, 5], with indices = [0, -1, 2, -1, 4]. M_SKIP_INVALID_POINTS Specifies to skip invalid points so that the output arrays contain only valid points. For example, if the input confidence = [1, 0, 1, 0, 1], and the input component = [3, 1, 4, 1, 5], then the data output array = [3, 4, 5], with indices = [0, 2, 4]. This is the default value. DstCoord1OrPackedArrayPtr Accepts the address of one of the following: array of type MIL_DOUBLE [optionally, in C++: a reference to a constant std::vector<MIL_DOUBLE> ] (and a maximum array rank for C# of 1) Required array size:(SrcArraySize) array of type MIL_FLOAT [optionally, in C++: a reference to a std::vector<MIL_FLOAT> ] (and a maximum array rank for C# of 1) Required array size:Call M3dimGetList() with DstCoord1OrPackedArrayPtr set to M_NULL, DstCoord2ArrayPtr set to M_NULL, DstCoord3ArrayPtr set to M_NULL, and IndexArrayPtr set to M_NULL. The array size is stored in the return value of the function. array of type MIL_INT16 [optionally, in C++: a reference to a std::vector<MIL_INT16> ] (and a maximum array rank for C# of 1) Required array size:Call M3dimGetList() with DstCoord1OrPackedArrayPtr set to M_NULL, DstCoord2ArrayPtr set to M_NULL, DstCoord3ArrayPtr set to M_NULL, and IndexArrayPtr set to M_NULL. The array size is stored in the return value of the function. array of type MIL_INT32 [optionally, in C++: a reference to a constant std::vector<MIL_INT32> ] (and a maximum array rank for C# of 1) Required array size:(SrcArraySize) array of type MIL_INT8 [optionally, in C++: a reference to a std::vector<MIL_INT8> ] (and a maximum array rank for C# of 1) Required array size:Call M3dimGetList() with DstCoord1OrPackedArrayPtr set to M_NULL, DstCoord2ArrayPtr set to M_NULL, DstCoord3ArrayPtr set to M_NULL, and IndexArrayPtr set to M_NULL. The array size is stored in the return value of the function. array of type MIL_UINT16 [optionally, in C++: a reference to a std::vector<MIL_UINT16> ] (and a maximum array rank for C# of 1) Required array size:Call M3dimGetList() with DstCoord1OrPackedArrayPtr set to M_NULL, DstCoord2ArrayPtr set to M_NULL, DstCoord3ArrayPtr set to M_NULL, and IndexArrayPtr set to M_NULL. The array size is stored in the return value of the function. array of type MIL_UINT32 [optionally, in C++: a reference to a std::vector<MIL_UINT32> ] (and a maximum array rank for C# of 1) Required array size:Call M3dimGetList() with DstCoord1OrPackedArrayPtr set to M_NULL, DstCoord2ArrayPtr set to M_NULL, DstCoord3ArrayPtr set to M_NULL, and IndexArrayPtr set to M_NULL. The array size is stored in the return value of the function. array of type MIL_UINT8 [optionally, in C++: a reference to a std::vector<MIL_UINT8> ] (and a maximum array rank for C# of 1) Required array size:Call M3dimGetList() with DstCoord1OrPackedArrayPtr set to M_NULL, DstCoord2ArrayPtr set to M_NULL, DstCoord3ArrayPtr set to M_NULL, and IndexArrayPtr set to M_NULL. The array size is stored in the return value of the function. Specifies the address of a user-defined array in which to store the retrieved data. This array can hold the values of the specified point cloud or depth map's component, or a packed array of all the data. For instance, the range component's 3 bands of coordinate data, if packed, is stored in the array in an interleaved manner (for example, XYZ XYZ XYZ...). Note that you can specify an array of the required type; MIL automatically casts the data into the appropriate type. When determining the required size of this array for subsequent calls to M3dimGetList(), set this parameter to M_NULL. DstCoord2ArrayPtr Accepts the address of one of the following: array of type MIL_DOUBLE [optionally, in C++: a reference to a constant std::vector<MIL_DOUBLE> ] (and a maximum array rank for C# of 1) Required array size:(SrcArraySize) array of type MIL_FLOAT [optionally, in C++: a reference to a std::vector<MIL_FLOAT> ] (and a maximum array rank for C# of 1) Required array size:Call M3dimGetList() with DstCoord1OrPackedArrayPtr set to M_NULL, DstCoord2ArrayPtr set to M_NULL, DstCoord3ArrayPtr set to M_NULL, and IndexArrayPtr set to M_NULL. The array size is stored in the return value of the function. array of type MIL_INT16 [optionally, in C++: a reference to a std::vector<MIL_INT16> ] (and a maximum array rank for C# of 1) Required array size:Call M3dimGetList() with DstCoord1OrPackedArrayPtr set to M_NULL, DstCoord2ArrayPtr set to M_NULL, DstCoord3ArrayPtr set to M_NULL, and IndexArrayPtr set to M_NULL. The array size is stored in the return value of the function. array of type MIL_INT32 [optionally, in C++: a reference to a constant std::vector<MIL_INT32> ] (and a maximum array rank for C# of 1) Required array size:(SrcArraySize) array of type MIL_INT8 [optionally, in C++: a reference to a std::vector<MIL_INT8> ] (and a maximum array rank for C# of 1) Required array size:Call M3dimGetList() with DstCoord1OrPackedArrayPtr set to M_NULL, DstCoord2ArrayPtr set to M_NULL, DstCoord3ArrayPtr set to M_NULL, and IndexArrayPtr set to M_NULL. The array size is stored in the return value of the function. array of type MIL_UINT16 [optionally, in C++: a reference to a std::vector<MIL_UINT16> ] (and a maximum array rank for C# of 1) Required array size:Call M3dimGetList() with DstCoord1OrPackedArrayPtr set to M_NULL, DstCoord2ArrayPtr set to M_NULL, DstCoord3ArrayPtr set to M_NULL, and IndexArrayPtr set to M_NULL. The array size is stored in the return value of the function. array of type MIL_UINT32 [optionally, in C++: a reference to a std::vector<MIL_UINT32> ] (and a maximum array rank for C# of 1) Required array size:Call M3dimGetList() with DstCoord1OrPackedArrayPtr set to M_NULL, DstCoord2ArrayPtr set to M_NULL, DstCoord3ArrayPtr set to M_NULL, and IndexArrayPtr set to M_NULL. The array size is stored in the return value of the function. array of type MIL_UINT8 [optionally, in C++: a reference to a std::vector<MIL_UINT8> ] (and a maximum array rank for C# of 1) Required array size:Call M3dimGetList() with DstCoord1OrPackedArrayPtr set to M_NULL, DstCoord2ArrayPtr set to M_NULL, DstCoord3ArrayPtr set to M_NULL, and IndexArrayPtr set to M_NULL. The array size is stored in the return value of the function. Specifies the address of a user-defined array in which to store the retrieved data. If the component is 3-band and Options is set to M_PLANAR, the pointer passed to DstCoord2ArrayPtr must be valid. If the component is 1-band or Options is set to M_PACKED, set DstCoord2ArrayPtr to M_NULL. Note that you can specify an array of the required type; MIL automatically casts the data into the appropriate type. When determining the required size of this array for subsequent calls to M3dimGetList(), set this parameter to M_NULL. DstCoord3ArrayPtr Accepts the address of one of the following: array of type MIL_DOUBLE [optionally, in C++: a reference to a constant std::vector<MIL_DOUBLE> ] (and a maximum array rank for C# of 1) Required array size:(SrcArraySize) array of type MIL_FLOAT [optionally, in C++: a reference to a std::vector<MIL_FLOAT> ] (and a maximum array rank for C# of 1) Required array size:Call M3dimGetList() with DstCoord1OrPackedArrayPtr set to M_NULL, DstCoord2ArrayPtr set to M_NULL, DstCoord3ArrayPtr set to M_NULL, and IndexArrayPtr set to M_NULL. The array size is stored in the return value of the function. Specifies the address of a user-defined array in which to store the retrieved data. If the component is 3-band and Options is set to M_PLANAR, the pointer passed to DstCoord3ArrayPtr must be valid. If the component is 1-band or Options is set to M_PACKED, set DstCoord3ArrayPtr to M_NULL. Note that you can specify an array of the required type; MIL automatically casts the data into the appropriate type. When determining the required size of this array for subsequent calls to M3dimGetList(), set this parameter to M_NULL. subEntries.title: M3dimGetResult
subEntries.text: M3dimGetResult Synopsis Get the specified type of result from a 3D image processing result buffer. Syntax MIL_DOUBLE M3dimGetResult( MIL_ID Result3dimId, //in MIL_INT64 ResultType, //in void *ResultArrayPtr //out ) Description This function retrieves the result(s) of the specified type from a result buffer. Parameters Parameters Result3dimId Specifies the identifier of the 3D image processing result buffer from which to retrieve results. The result buffer must have been previously allocated on the system using M3dimAllocResult() with M_FIND_TRANSFORMATION_RESULT, M_LATTICE_RESULT, M_PROFILE_RESULT, or M_STATISTICS_RESULT. See the Parameter associations section for possible values that can be specified. ResultType Specifies the type of result to retrieve. See the Parameter associations section for possible values that can be specified. ResultArrayPtr Accepts the address of one of the following (see the Parameter associations section for specifics on which is expected): array of type MIL_DOUBLE [optionally, in C++: a reference to a std::vector<MIL_DOUBLE> ] array of type MIL_FLOAT [optionally, in C++: a reference to a std::vector<MIL_FLOAT> ] array of type MIL_INT [optionally, in C++: a reference to a std::vector<MIL_INT> ] array of type MIL_INT32 [optionally, in C++: a reference to a std::vector<MIL_INT32> ] array of type MIL_INT64 [optionally, in C++: a reference to a std::vector<MIL_INT64> ] MIL_DOUBLE MIL_FLOAT MIL_INT MIL_INT32 MIL_INT64 Specifies the address of the array in which to write the requested information. See the Parameter associations section for possible values that can be returned. Parameter associations The table below lists possible values for the Result3dimId and ResultType parameters and possible values returned to the ResultArrayPtr parameter. For specifying the type of result to retrieve from a find transformation, profile, or statistics 3D image processing result buffer The following Result3dimId, ResultType, and ResultArrayPtr parameter settings can be specified for different types of 3D image processing result buffers. For specifying the type of result to retrieve from a find transformation, profile, or statistics 3D image processing result buffer Result3dimId Description ResultType ResultArrayPtr - Possible values returned Find transformation 3D image processing result ID Specifies the identifier of a find transformation 3D image processing result buffer. For a M_FIND_TRANSFORMATION_RESULT result buffer, results are available after using M3dimFindTransformation() to fill the result buffer with the rigid or affine transformation matrix. M_NUMBER_OF_POINT_PAIRS Retrieves the number of valid point pairs used when finding the transformation. ResultArrayPtr extra info Data type info: Data type: address of a MIL_INT Data type: address of a MIL_INT M_RMS_ERROR Retrieves the root-mean-square (RMS) error between the point pairs if the matrix was applied. MIL calculates the RMS error using the following formula: ResultArrayPtr extra info Data type info: Data type: address of a MIL_DOUBLE Data type: address of a MIL_DOUBLE M_STATUS Retrieves the status of the find transformation operation. ResultArrayPtr extra info Data type info: Data type: address of a MIL_INT Data type: address of a MIL_INT M_ALL_POINTS_COPLANAR Specifies that all point pairs are in the same plane and that the operation to find an affine transformation could not proceed. M_NOT_ENOUGH_POINT_PAIRS Specifies that there are either less than 3 point pairs (for a rigid transformation) or 4 point pairs (for an affine transformation) and that the operation could not proceed. M_NOT_INITIALIZED Specifies that the operation was not initialized. M_SUCCESS Specifies that the transformation matrix was successfully found. Lattice 3D image processing result ID Specifies the identifier of a lattice 3D image processing result buffer. For a M_LATTICE_RESULT result buffer, results are available after using M3dimLattice() to fill the result buffer with a lattice. M_CELL_SIZE_X Retrieves the cell size in the X-direction. ResultArrayPtr extra info Data type info: Data type: address of a MIL_DOUBLE Data type: address of a MIL_DOUBLE M_INFINITE Specifies an infinite cell size along X. Value > 0 Specifies the cell size along X, in world units. M_CELL_SIZE_Y Retrieves the cell size in the Y-direction. ResultArrayPtr extra info Data type info: Data type: address of a MIL_DOUBLE Data type: address of a MIL_DOUBLE M_INFINITE Specifies an infinite cell size along Y. Value > 0 Specifies the cell size along Y, in world units. M_CELL_SIZE_Z Retrieves the cell size in the Z-direction. ResultArrayPtr extra info Data type info: Data type: address of a MIL_DOUBLE Data type: address of a MIL_DOUBLE M_INFINITE Specifies an infinite cell size along Z. Value > 0 Specifies the cell size along Z, in world units. M_NUMBER_OF_CELLS_X Retrieves the number of cells in the X-direction. ResultArrayPtr extra info Data type info: Data type: address of a MIL_INT Data type: address of a MIL_INT Value > 0 Specifies the number of cells along X. M_NUMBER_OF_CELLS_Y Retrieves the number of cells in the Y-direction. ResultArrayPtr extra info Data type info: Data type: address of a MIL_INT Data type: address of a MIL_INT Value > 0 Specifies the number of cells along Y. M_NUMBER_OF_CELLS_Z Retrieves the number of cells in the Z-direction. ResultArrayPtr extra info Data type info: Data type: address of a MIL_INT Data type: address of a MIL_INT Value > 0 Specifies the number of cells along Z. M_START_POINT_X Retrieves the X-coordinate of the lattice's start point, expressed in the working coordinate system. ResultArrayPtr extra info Data type info: Data type: address of a MIL_DOUBLE Data type: address of a MIL_DOUBLE M_START_POINT_Y Retrieves the Y-coordinate of the lattice's start point, expressed in the working coordinate system. ResultArrayPtr extra info Data type info: Data type: address of a MIL_DOUBLE Data type: address of a MIL_DOUBLE M_START_POINT_Z Retrieves the Z-coordinate of the lattice's start point, expressed in the working coordinate system. ResultArrayPtr extra info Data type info: Data type: address of a MIL_DOUBLE Data type: address of a MIL_DOUBLE M_STATUS Retrieves the status of the lattice operation. ResultArrayPtr extra info Data type info: Data type: address of a MIL_INT Data type: address of a MIL_INT M_NOT_ENOUGH_VALID_DATA Specifies that the lattice operation failed because a bounding box was not provided and could not be calculated from the point cloud because there were not enough valid points (less than 2). M_NOT_INITIALIZED Specifies that the lattice 3D image processing result buffer was not used in a call to M3dimLattice(), and contains no results. M_SUCCESS Specifies that the lattice operation completed successfully. Profile 3D image processing result ID Specifies the identifier of a profile 3D image processing result buffer. For a M_PROFILE_RESULT result buffer, results are available after using M3dimProfile() or M3dimProfileEx() to fill the result buffer with a profile. Note that you can transform coordinates from M_PROFILE_PLANE_... to M_WORLD_... (and vice versa). To do so, copy profile results into a transformation matrix, using M3dimCopyResult() with M_MATRIX_PROFILE_PLANE_TO_WORLD or M_MATRIX_WORLD_TO_PROFILE_PLANE, and then pass the resulting transformation matrix to M3dimMatrixTransformList(). For depth maps, transforming M_WORLD_... point coordinate values using McalTransformCoordinate3dList() will yield values close to those obtained with M_PROFILE_PLANE_..., but exactly on the profile line. M_NUMBER_OF_POINTS_MISSING_DATA Retrieves the number of missing data points (gap pixels) encountered when creating the depth map profile; for other profiles, this result type always returns 0. This result type is available only after an M3dimProfile() operation. ResultArrayPtr extra info Data type info: Data type: address of a MIL_INT Data type: address of a MIL_INT M_NUMBER_OF_POINTS_VALID Retrieves the number of valid points along the profile. Note that all extracted profile points are valid; therefore, this number equals the total number of points in the profile. This result type is available only after an M3dimProfile() operation. ResultArrayPtr extra info Data type info: Data type: address of a MIL_INT Data type: address of a MIL_INT M_PIXEL_X Retrieves the pixel X-coordinates for valid points included in the profile. Each 3D point has a corresponding pixel in the depth map image buffer or point cloud range component. M_PIXEL_X returns an integer value, for each profile point, which corresponds to the pixel's position along X in the depth map or range component. Note that M_PIXEL_X is unavailable for profiles of type M_PROFILE_MESH and M_PROFILE_GEOMETRY. This result type is available only after an M3dimProfile() operation. ResultArrayPtr extra info Data type info: Data type: array of type MIL_INT [optionally, in C++: a reference to a std::vector<MIL_INT> ] MORE Data type: array of type MIL_INT [optionally, in C++: a reference to a std::vector<MIL_INT> ] Required array size: M3dimGetResult ( M_NUMBER_OF_POINTS_VALID ) M_PIXEL_Y Retrieves the pixel Y-coordinates for valid points included in the profile. Each 3D point has a corresponding pixel in the depth map image buffer or point cloud range component. M_PIXEL_Y returns an integer value, for each profile point, which corresponds to the pixel's position along Y in the depth map or range component. Note that M_PIXEL_Y is unavailable for profiles of type M_PROFILE_MESH. This result type is available only after an M3dimProfile() operation. ResultArrayPtr extra info Data type info: Data type: array of type MIL_INT [optionally, in C++: a reference to a std::vector<MIL_INT> ] MORE Data type: array of type MIL_INT [optionally, in C++: a reference to a std::vector<MIL_INT> ] Required array size: M3dimGetResult ( M_NUMBER_OF_POINTS_VALID ) M_PROFILE_PLANE_X Retrieves the X-coordinates from the resulting profile, expressed in the coordinate system of the slicing plane itself, in world units. For a depth map profile, points are extracted from pixels along the specified line. M_PROFILE_PLANE_X returns the real world distance along that line, for each extracted point. Note that the line's start point (set using M3dimProfile() with M_PROFILE_DEPTH_MAP and Param2 and Param3, or using M3dimProfileEx() with Param2 and Param3) represents a distance of 0. The line is effectively the X-axis for a plot of M_PROFILE_PLANE_X and M_PROFILE_PLANE_Y values, which sit on the slicing plane. For other profile types, the returned values correspond to the X-coordinates of the profile's points, expressed in the specified slicing plane's coordinate system. You can draw the M_PROFILE_PLANE_X and M_PROFILE_PLANE_Y values in a 2D display using MgraDots(). Alternatively, you can draw the profile points using M3dimDraw3d(). ResultArrayPtr extra info Data type info: Data type: array of type MIL_DOUBLE [optionally, in C++: a reference to a std::vector<MIL_DOUBLE> ] MORE Data type: array of type MIL_DOUBLE [optionally, in C++: a reference to a std::vector<MIL_DOUBLE> ] Required array size: M3dimGetResult ( M_NUMBER_OF_POINTS_VALID ) M_PROFILE_PLANE_Y Retrieves the Y-coordinates from the resulting profile, expressed in the coordinate system of the slicing plane itself, in world units. For a depth map profile, the returned values correspond to the depth at each pixel underneath the specified line. For other profile types, the returned values correspond to the Y-coordinates of the profile's points, expressed in the specified slicing plane's coordinate system. You can draw the M_PROFILE_PLANE_X and M_PROFILE_PLANE_Y values in a 2D display using MgraDots(). Alternatively, you can draw the profile points using M3dimDraw3d(). ResultArrayPtr extra info Data type info: Data type: array of type MIL_DOUBLE [optionally, in C++: a reference to a std::vector<MIL_DOUBLE> ] MORE Data type: array of type MIL_DOUBLE [optionally, in C++: a reference to a std::vector<MIL_DOUBLE> ] Required array size: M3dimGetResult ( M_NUMBER_OF_POINTS_VALID ) M_PROFILE_TYPE Retrieves the profile type. ResultArrayPtr extra info Data type info: Data type: address of a MIL_INT Data type: address of a MIL_INT M_NOT_INITIALIZED Specifies that a profile type has not been defined for the profile result. M_PROFILE_DEPTH_MAP Specifies a depth map profile. This result is available only after an M3dimProfile() operation. M_PROFILE_DEPTH_MAP_UNIFORM Specifies a uniform depth map profile, where the points are at equal distances from each other along the profile line defined by the start and end points. This result is available only after an M3dimProfileEx() operation. M_PROFILE_GEOMETRY Specifies a 3D geometry profile. This result is available only after an M3dimProfile() operation. M_PROFILE_MESH Specifies a mesh profile. This result is available only after an M3dimProfile() operation. M_PROFILE_POINT_CLOUD Specifies a point cloud profile. This result is available only after an M3dimProfile() operation. M_STATUS Retrieves the status of the profile operation. ResultArrayPtr extra info Data type info: Data type: address of a MIL_INT Data type: address of a MIL_INT M_COMPLETE Specifies that the profile operation completed successfully. M_INFINITE_PROFILE Specifies that the profile operation failed and yielded an infinite result. This result is available only after an M3dimProfile() operation. M_MISSING_COMPONENT_MESH_MIL Specifies that the profile operation failed because the source point cloud container does not have an M_COMPONENT_MESH_MIL component. This result is available only after an M3dimProfile() operation. M_NO_PROFILE Specifies that no profile was found; the slicing plane did not intersect the source. M_NOT_INITIALIZED Specifies that the profile operation was not initialized. M_WORLD_X Retrieves the world X-coordinates for the extracted points. For a depth map, the returned values correspond to each extracted point's pixel position along X, in world units. For a point cloud, mesh, or 3D geometry profile, the returned values correspond to each extracted point's position in the point cloud along X, in world units. You can draw the M_WORLD_X, M_WORLD_Y, and M_WORLD_Z values in a 3D display using M3dgraDots(). ResultArrayPtr extra info Data type info: Data type: array of type MIL_DOUBLE [optionally, in C++: a reference to a std::vector<MIL_DOUBLE> ] MORE Data type: array of type MIL_DOUBLE [optionally, in C++: a reference to a std::vector<MIL_DOUBLE> ] Required array size: M3dimGetResult ( M_NUMBER_OF_POINTS_VALID ) M_WORLD_Y Retrieves the world Y-coordinates for the extracted points. For a depth map, the returned values correspond to each extracted point's pixel position along Y, in world units. For a point cloud, mesh, or 3D geometry profile, the returned values correspond to each extracted point's position in the point cloud along Y, in world units. You can draw the M_WORLD_X, M_WORLD_Y, and M_WORLD_Z values in a 3D display using M3dgraDots(). ResultArrayPtr extra info Data type info: Data type: array of type MIL_DOUBLE [optionally, in C++: a reference to a std::vector<MIL_DOUBLE> ] MORE Data type: array of type MIL_DOUBLE [optionally, in C++: a reference to a std::vector<MIL_DOUBLE> ] Required array size: M3dimGetResult ( M_NUMBER_OF_POINTS_VALID ) M_WORLD_Z Retrieves the world Z-coordinates for the extracted points. For a depth map, the returned values correspond to each extracted point's depth value (distance along Z), in world units. For a point cloud, mesh, or 3D geometery profile, the returned values correspond to each extracted point's position in the point cloud along Z, in world units. You can draw the M_WORLD_X, M_WORLD_Y, and M_WORLD_Z values in a 3D display using M3dgraDots(). ResultArrayPtr extra info Data type info: Data type: array of type MIL_DOUBLE [optionally, in C++: a reference to a std::vector<MIL_DOUBLE> ] MORE Data type: array of type MIL_DOUBLE [optionally, in C++: a reference to a std::vector<MIL_DOUBLE> ] Required array size: M3dimGetResult ( M_NUMBER_OF_POINTS_VALID ) Statistics 3D image processing result ID Specifies the identifier of a statistics 3D image processing result buffer. For a M_STATISTICS_RESULT result buffer, results are available after using M3dimStat() to fill the result buffer with statistics on a container's point cloud, on a depth map, or on a 3D geometry. M_MOMENT_CENTRAL_XYZ( MIL_INT PowerX, MIL_INT PowerY, MIL_INT PowerZ ) Retrieves the central moment corresponding to the specified powers of X, Y, and Z. For point clouds and depth maps, this is equivalent to the following formula, where  is the centroid and (xi , yi , zi) is the i th point: For 3D geometries, this is equivalent to the following surface integral formula, where  is the centroid. For line geometries, MIL uses a line integral instead. This result type is available for centroid, moments, number-of-points, or PCA statistics results. To retrieve the respective central moment results, you must ensure that the sum of PowerX, PowerY, and PowerZ complies with the following: Statistics type (PowerX + PowerY + PowerZ) must be: centroid <= 1 moments <= M_MOMENT_ORDER (set using M3dimControl()) number-of-points 0 PCA <= 2 Filters: fc_A: [{I: f_7, f_9, f_10, f_12}] Parameters PowerX Specifies the power in X. Value >= 0 Specifies the power. PowerY Specifies the power in Y. Value >= 0 Specifies the power. PowerZ Specifies the power in Z. Value >= 0 Specifies the power. ResultArrayPtr extra info Data type info: Data type: address of a MIL_DOUBLE Data type: address of a MIL_DOUBLE M_MOMENT_XYZ( MIL_INT PowerX, MIL_INT PowerY, MIL_INT PowerZ ) Retrieves the (non-central) moment corresponding to the specified powers of X, Y, and Z. For point clouds and depth maps, this is equivalent to the following formula, where (xi , yi , zi) is the i th point: For 3D geometries, this is equivalent to the following surface integral formula: For line geometries, MIL uses a line integral instead. This result type is available for centroid, moments, number-of-points, or PCA statistics results. To retrieve the respective (non-central) moment results, you must ensure that the sum of PowerX, PowerY, and PowerZ complies with the following: Statistics type (PowerX + PowerY + PowerZ) must be: centroid <= 1 moments <= M_MOMENT_ORDER (set using M3dimControl()) number-of-points 0 PCA <= 2 Filters: fc_A: [{I: f_7, f_9, f_10, f_12}] Parameters PowerX Specifies the power in X. Value >= 0 Specifies the power. PowerY Specifies the power in Y. Value >= 0 Specifies the power. PowerZ Specifies the power in Z. Value >= 0 Specifies the power. ResultArrayPtr extra info Data type info: Data type: address of a MIL_DOUBLE Data type: address of a MIL_DOUBLE M_BOX_CENTER_X Retrieves the X-coordinate of the center of the bounding box. This result type is available for bounding box statistics results. The bounding box is an axis-aligned or semi-oriented box that contains all or most of the points in the 3D scene, or it encloses a 3D geometry object. ResultArrayPtr extra info Data type info: Data type: address of a MIL_DOUBLE Data type: address of a MIL_DOUBLE M_BOX_CENTER_Y Retrieves the Y-coordinate of the center of the bounding box.
